meanings.definition: Excessive packaging that is unnecessary or wasteful.
meanings.sent1: The overpackaging of the small toy made it difficult to open.
meanings.sent2: The overpackaging of the product resulted in a lot of unnecessary waste.
meanings.sent3: The overpackaging of the cookies made them look like tiny presents.
meanings.sent4: The overpackaging of the gift was like wrapping a single grape in a huge box.
meanings.sent5: The overpackaging of the fragile items made them seem like precious treasures.

meanings.definition: To package something in a way that uses more materials than needed.
meanings.sent1: Please do not overpackage the fragile items; it will only create more waste.
meanings.sent2: The company tends to overpackage their products, leading to unnecessary costs.
meanings.sent3: He overpackaged the sandwiches, making them look like giant food pillows.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was overpackaging her emotions, hiding them behind layers of words.
meanings.sent5: The chef overpackaged the dish with unnecessary garnishes, making it hard to eat.
